alert.note: Alert for Carter (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 1:25PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Carter County through 215 PM CDT... At 123 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fremont, or 11 miles west of Van Buren, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning will be dangerous persons outside. Locations impacted include... Fremont, Van Buren and the Current River area in Carter County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
